channel.title: Getting Started on Gen AI Toolbox
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on Gen AI Toolbox

item.title: Quickstart
item.description:
Before you begin

This guide assumes you have already done the following:

  1. Installed Python 3.9+ (including pip and your preferred virtual environment tool for managing dependencies e.g. venv)

  2. Installed PostgreSQL 16+ and the psql client

  3. Completed setup for usage with an LLM model such as

    • `langchain-vertexai`<a href="https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/llms/google_vertex_ai_palm/#setup">package</a>.<br>
`langchain-google-genai`<a href="https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/google_generative_ai/#setup">package</a>. <br>
`langchain-anthropic`<a href="https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/anthropic/#setup">package</a>.

    </div>
<div class="tab-body tab-pane fade"
 id="tabs-00-01" role="tabpanel" aria-labelled-by="tabs-00-01-tab" tabindex="0">
 <pre><code>`llama-index-llms-vertex`<a href="https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/examples/llm/vertex/">package</a>.<br>

    llama-index-llms-gemini<a href="https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/examples/llm/gemini/">package</a>.<br> llama-index-llms-anthropic<a href="https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/examples/llm/anthropic/">package</a>

item.title: Configuration
item.description:
The primary way to configure Toolbox is through the tools.yaml file. If you have multiple files, you can tell toolbox which to load with the --tools_file tools.yaml flag.

You can find more detailed reference documentation to all resource types in the Resources.

Sources

The sources section of your tools.yaml defines what data sources your Toolbox should have access to. Most tools will have at least one source to execute against.
